newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Dexia sees further earnings growth in 97.
newsitem.headline: Dexia sees further earnings growth in 97.

text.p: Belgo-French banking alliance Dexia said on Tuesday it expected further earnings growth in 1997.

Francois Narmon, chief executive officer of Dexia Belgium and management board chairman of Credit Communal de Belgique (CCB), told a news conference the growth would come from expansion both at home and internationally in the group's main activities, public sector lending.
Dexia also planned to grow its private banking and asset management activities, while striving to keep acquisition costs under control.
Narmon said Dexia would launch new products to meet client demand. He gave no details.
Dexia announced earlier its 1996 group net profit rose 13.1 percent on a proforma basis to 19.4 billion Belgian francs.
